intro: Gilbertiodendron maximum, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The tree produces a fruit that contains a valuable seed used for oil extraction. Its bark and leaves are also utilized in traditional medicine for their therapeutic properties. Gilbertiodendron maximum plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various wildlife species.
